metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1076 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux Kernel. The tun/tap sockets have their socket UID hardcoded to 0 due to a type confusion in their initialization function. While it will be often correct, as tuntap devices require CAP_NET_ADMIN, it may not always be the case, e.g., a non-root user only having that capability. This would make tun/tap sockets being incorrectly treated in filtering/routing decisions, possibly bypassing network filters. It was discovered that the TUN/TAP driver in the Linux kernel did not properly initialize socket data. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic-64k - 5.15.0-75.82
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1038-aws - 5.15.0-1038.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-aws - 6.2.0-1005.5~22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> the fix for this CVE was determined as incorrect or incomplete, CVE-2023-4194 was published to address this.
